notes.title: Funding
notes.p: The present work was funded by the European Union (ERDF) and Greek national funds through the Operational Program “Competitiveness, Entrepreneurship and Innovation,” under the call “STRENGTHENING RESEARCH AND INNOVATION INFRASTRUCTURES” (project code: 5002803) ( www.plant-up.com, accessed on 4 March 2021). Regarding the repellant bioassays, this study was supported by the LIFE CONOPS project. The project LIFE CONOPS (LIFE12 ENV/GR/000466) is funded by the European Commission in the framework of the program LIFE + Environment Policy and Governance ( www.conops.gr, accessed on 4 March 2021). The authors A.M. and D.P. are members of the AIM-COST Action (CA17108, https://www.aedescost.eu, accessed on 4 March 2021) supported by COST (European Cooperation in Science and Technology; www.cost.eu, accessed on 4 March 2021).
